response.overview: Thousands from the Tuareg community in Algeria flock to the annual Sebeiba festival held in an oasis town deep in the Sahara. Sebeiba is an annual Tuareg cultural event held in the oasis of Djanet, in the extreme south of Algeria. This colourful festival dates back thousands of years and since 2014 has been a UNESCO ‘Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity’ event.
response.title: Sebeiba festival: Algeria’s 3,000 year-old tradition
